Class FiveCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • FiveCard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class FiveCard
extends java.awt.Container
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    (c) 2012 Bohde Productions Inc. All Rights Reserved. This class creates the main interface used to play the game. It contains the menus and code structure to manage the players money throughout the casino and dealing with switching games, creating games, and quitting games.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isIn

        private boolean isIn(Card b)
        Checks to see if Card b is clicked and within replace
        Parameters:
        b - The card to check whether it has been clicked and is in the ArrayList of cards to be replaced
        Returns:
        true if the card has been clicked and is in the ArrayList of cards to be replaced, false otherwise

      • displayCompCards

        private void displayCompCards()
        Displays the computers cards. Until this method is called, the cards faceShowing instance variable is false, and the image showing on screen is the back of the card. This method flips the cards by calling flip() and repaints them on screen. Finally, all buttons which control the users gameplay are removed from the screen except for the one to calculate results so that the user cannot continue to bet after having seen the dealers cards.

      • compTurn

        private void compTurn()
        Computers gameplay. Replaces up to three random cards, then creates a random bet for the computer. If the random bet for the computer is less than the amount of GameFrame.cash, the computer's bet is set to the amound of use cash. Next, if the computer's bet is greater than 0, call is then set visible. If GameFrame.cash equals 0, raise, call, and fold, are set to not visible, and results is set to visible.
        See Also:
        replaceCompCards(), raise, call, fold, results

      • replaceCompCards

        private void replaceCompCards()
        Replaces randomly selected cards in the computers hand as part of the computers gameplay in both the array of cards representing the computers hand and on screen, and then repaints the screen.
        See Also:
        compTurn()

      • findMinimum

        private int findMinimum(Card[] a,
              int first)
        Finds the card with the least face value at or after index first in the array of cards a.
        Parameters:
        a - the Card array being organized by organize(Card[] hand)
        first - the index to start at i
        Returns:
        the index of the Card with the least face value.
        See Also:
        organize(Card[] hand)

      • organize

        private void organize(Card[] hand)
        Organizes a hand to greatly simplify evaluating the hand and calculating the winner.
        See Also:
        findMinimum(Card[], int), getWin()

      • showWinDlg

        private void showWinDlg(java.lang.String playerHand,
              java.lang.String compHand,
              java.lang.String winner)
        Displays dialog with the results of the hand, stating the winner, loser, and both their hands Then displays dialog asking user if they'd like to play another hand, or leave the table and return to the main screen.
        Parameters:
        playerHand - the hand that the player has as determined by getWin()
        compHand - the hand that the computer has as determined by getWin()
        winner - will be either "Player" or "Computer", assigned based on winner as determined by getWin()
        See Also:
        getWin()

      • resetBackground

        private void resetBackground()
        Resets original main screen. Used when user chooses to leave table between hands.

      • getWin

        private void getWin()
        Evaluates both the computer's and player's hands and determines the winner.
        See Also:
        checkFlush(), checkStraight(), check3(), check2Pair(), checkPair()

      • checkFour

        private boolean[] checkFour()
        Looks for a four of a kind in both hands
        Returns:
        A boolean array. array[0] and array[1] represent whether the player and computer have four of the same card, respectively.

      • checkFull

        private boolean[] check3()

        Returns:
